snippet: In testimony, Kevin O’Dowd said he had believed the assurances of his deputy, Bridget Anne Kelly, that she was not involved in the closing of lanes to the George Washington Bridge.
abstract: Kevin O’Dowd, chief of staff for New Jersey Gov Chris Christie, testifies that he had no knowledge in September, 2013, of the decision to close several traffic lanes to the George Washington Bridge; says he believed the assurances of his deputy, Bridget Anne Kelly, that she was not involved, a position later undermined by emails and text messages.

byline.contributor: Kate Zernike contributed reporting from Trenton.

lead_paragraph: In testimony, Kevin O’Dowd said he had believed the assurances of his deputy, Bridget Anne Kelly, that she was not involved in the closing of lanes to the George Washington Bridge.
